title: (x) "Survivor" TV show logo - Bloc Heavy {Stephen}
content: Can someone please tell me what font is used for the words "outwit, outplay, outlast" on the "Survivor" TV show logo? I know that the font "Survivant" is used for the word "SURVIVOR" on the logo, but the font used for the words "outwit,outplay,outlast" is slightly different. Please help me! Thanks.
author: Filmkid2003

comments.content: All caps title? Please fix that.

Is it possibly Oz Poster? As seen on the most useful Bowfin Printworks [Sans Serif Font Identification Aid/Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223132511/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SansIDPage.html).

You could do worse than the Ultra weight of Today. Although it's not an exact match, the W is similar, as is the overal weight and geo-meets-humanist construction:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/today-b-ef-ultra/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223132511/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/today-b-ef-ultra/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/today-b-ef-ultra/")

Dang it, Stephen. I knew it was the same font Vibe(!?) has been using on its covers, but couldn't remember the name, so I settled for a lousy approximation.

Well played!

Hah! WTF has trouble with ultra heavy letters at small sizes. This is one of those samples that is ideal for [TypeNav](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223132511/http:/typenav.fontshop.com/).

I've been seeing this face more often, too. It's also known as [Informal Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223132511/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.9378.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=OUTWITPLAYS&sampleSize=40) (kerning not good) and Berthold Block (which is available elsewhere, but I'd rather see any sales go to ParaType -- and FS of course -- than Bert).
Thanks guys! You guys rock... especially you, Stephen! I appreciate the help. Does anyone know where I can get Bloc Heavy for less than $29.00? Thanks again!
$29 is a mid- to low-range price for a single font. You won't find it for much less.
Hey, Grotesque, my mom is dead, which makes you a necrophiliac, you sick-o!
